column4: I'm a fast learning newbie. I pick up stuff fast, but I usually miss some things (probably because of short attention span ;)
And sometimes I never get that far into learning about something.
viperborg: huh?
This is starting to get really confusing
Sorry, had a forced reboot. The idea is to select the correct repository for KDE 4.2 and then just download the package(s), not install them.
There are some apt- tools that might help, possibly on the system you're intending to install KDE4.2 to.
to use on a win2000 pc?
No, to use with your Live Disk.
the idea is to avoid LiveCDs in school
Either you have a Linux setup available, or you're likely to struggle downloading packages via apt-get
apt-get on windows ! ?
No! Afaik, you can't do apt-get on windows. If it's feasible, cygwin *might* do it, but I'm not convinced.
I want to avoid BOTH LiveCDs and Cygwin in school
If you have install privs, then VirtualBox might be a good idea.
Otherwise, just forget it :)
Forgetting about it is not an option either ;)
You might as well be asking how to run WindowsUpdate in Ubuntu..
:D
Why not? ;)
Alternatively, why not download KDE4.2 source from svn/wherever and compile yourself.. another option.
Where's the svn?
Now you're getting lazy! Google, my friend.
That's shorthand for "ignore him"
